reviewText: Great performance, but the production leaves much to be desired. Not sure who was the brilliant guy behind the production, but they killed the concert with this pissed poor production. As estated above by another reviewer, some cameras are 4x3 stretched to 16x9. Sound in 2009 should be far better than that, period...Warren, Derek your own concerts are far better recorded, why let an a$$ ruin this wonderful night with bad decisions about how we should watch a concert, if you filmed in 4:3. just leave it in 4:3, who cares? But why stretching the image? That is simply ridiculous, an unnaceptable, do you really believe that anybody will believe that a drum is an oval? Maybe in Mars!!!
summary: The video was a very lame production!!!
Title: Allman Brothers/40: 40th Anniversary Show Live At The Beacon Theatre

reviewText: Great Set list and good performance, but video production suffers. Some cameras are 4x3 stretched to 16x9. Stereo sound is highly compressed and low in volume. Appears to be a low production that was done by a band on a budget, but still good to see the brothers do this tribute to the first band.
Title: Allman Brothers/40: 40th Anniversary Show Live At The Beacon Theatre

reviewText: I enjoyed this DVD. What I am impressed with greatly is how great Gregg Allman sings and is genuinely on fire in this concert. I felt the sound mix could have been better but overall the sound in 5.1 is good. I agree the stereo mix is not that great, flat and not dynamic as the 5.1 mix sounds. The guitar playing is top notch from Warren and Derrek, the filming seems to mostly focus on them. Overall I am happy this concert was put on DVD as I missed their final tour despite being in the USA recently. I am hoping more footage from this tour will come out such as the footage with Clapton and other guests.
Title: Allman Brothers/40: 40th Anniversary Show Live At The Beacon Theatre

reviewText: it's good to see the brothers have still got it,  I'm glad greg got his voice back, the boose was killing it!!!
summary: it's good to see the brothers have still got it
Title: Allman Brothers/40: 40th Anniversary Show Live At The Beacon Theatre

reviewText: This DVD is great. Sounds good too. Alos bought for my Husband, he is totally thrilled with these CD's/DVD.  All came on time and in great condition.
Title: Allman Brothers/40: 40th Anniversary Show Live At The Beacon Theatre

reviewText: There's enough about the description of this to make you skeptical: when you read they're playing the first two albums, you might fear that it's merely a faithful recreation of what you heard 40 years ago. But that's not the case. On the prior Beacon DVD the band seemed to hew to the original solos too much, but that's not the case here. The years have made a difference in terms of the comfort with the material and the chemistry in the band. It's looser, less formal, and the performances here are clearly a product of THIS band, not the one from 1971.That means that the solos are different, the interludes are different, and it's a new experience.Revival not only builds in the snippets of "Joy To The World" you remember from Fillmore East, but it's a major springboard for variations. And Elizabeth Reed is stunning; a really great bass solo (with Derek Trucks looking on appreciatively as it happens) followed by the bass player sitting behind Butch's drum kit while Butch mans the tympani, and we get to see an interlude of four drummers going at once.I won't hesitate to review with two or three stars on Amazon. This one gets five: It's really splendid. Don't hesitate for a moment.
summary: I couldn't be more pleased with this
Title: Allman Brothers/40: 40th Anniversary Show Live At The Beacon Theatre
Allman Brothers/40: 40th Anniversary Show Live At The Beacon Theatre

reviewText: I have loved the Allman Brothers since seeing them @ the Fillmore East. I have all their albums & have seen them every year they toured. This is a great representation of their music
Title: Allman Brothers/40: 40th Anniversary Show Live At The Beacon Theatre

reviewText: Although there have been better nights, this set once again proves the value and quality of music that is the standard of the allman Brothers. Excluding the Duane and Barry days, this line up carries on in a grand tradition with nothing left to prove.
Title: Allman Brothers/40: 40th Anniversary Show Live At The Beacon Theatre

reviewText: Wow what I show, wish I was there but this is like being there!You can feel the energy it's awesome!The band actually ripped through the first 2 albums, all killer & no filler!Performance: A+Sound quality: A+Video Quality: A+Camera Angles: A+Lighting: A+This is the very best live concert dvd from this group and a must have for all ABB fans!And don't forget to play it loud!
Title: Allman Brothers/40: 40th Anniversary Show Live At The Beacon Theatre

reviewText: I took the plunge in 2009 and ordered the Beacon Box set.  After the long wait it arrived to its new home.  I was blown away by this music.  They had so many fantastic artist play with them.  I played it and played it, never get tired of it.  Now we have the DVD release, its great.  If you are a ABB fan this is a no brainer.  The band is really tight, great sound quality.  Maybe in the future they will release the entire thing, that would be a monster release for sure.  This delivers, must have for any fan.
summary: Some of the best music ever recorded.
Title: Allman Brothers/40: 40th Anniversary Show Live At The Beacon Theatre
